scenarioDescription:
The HD 34445 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 34445 is a star with 1.14 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 150.33 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 34445 is known to have 6 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 34445 system


HD 34445 b

HD 34445 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 b is 260.760 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 b is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 34445 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 34445 c

HD 34445 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2017-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.72 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 c is 53.424 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 c is 8.420 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 34445 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 34445 d

HD 34445 d was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2017-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.48 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 d is 30.846 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 d is 6.070 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 34445 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 34445 e

HD 34445 e was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2017-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 e is 16.822 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 e is 4.260 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 34445 e is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 34445 f

HD 34445 f was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2017-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.54 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 f is 37.842 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 f is 6.880 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 34445 f is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 34445 g

HD 34445 g was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2017-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 6.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 34445 g is 120.840 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 34445 g is 13.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 34445 g is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 34445, which contains 6 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 34445 - System With 6 Exoplanets
